Name: Thiefdom
Description:
In Thiefdom players represent competing thief guilds who steal from the rich medieval town called Bacharach to declare the most skillful thieves guild. It is a strategic, interactive and thematic pickup & deliver game for 1-4 players.

Each player controls a team of three cunning thieves, each armed with their own set of equipments. But be warned, the city guards are on high alert, and it's up to all players to control their movements to avoid detection. With items like grappling hooks, climbing tools, and smoke bombs at your disposal, you'll have to use all your wits to avoid getting caught. In case of a detention, a thief loses all their loot and some victory points.

The game is played over 6 nights (rounds) and the player with the most victory points is declared the winner.

One night contains: 

     Planning Phase: All players simultaneously plan the order in which they want to move their three thieves and the neutral figurines they control that night (city guards, carriage, nobles). Then they reveal at the same time. 
     Action Phase (Night): The players carry out the actions in the predefined order from the planning phase. 
     Administration Phase (Day): Cleanup and preparation for the next night. 


The town setup includes 8 modular and double-printed town quarters, resulting in a unique pickup & deliver puzzle in each game. There are 12 different equipments thieves can buy to gain new abilities, and 36 unique guests in the tavern to support your guild.

-description from publisher

Name: Rhodesian Railways
Description:
From Capetown to Salisbury, from Durban to Walvis Bay, the railroads of Africa spanned a continent of jungles, deserts, veldt, swamps and mountains. German SouthWestAfrica, Cape Colony, Orange Free State, Transvaal, Bechuanaland, Mozambique, Natal and Rhodesia are the scope of this luckless economic game where the most money at the end of the game wins.

Ports are crucial to start a railroad, penetrating the terrain is expensive & difficult. Business interests drive players inland in this game for 3-5 players for about one hour. Loans are taken for intensive capital investment, with the game ending when one player has expended all their cubes.

Historically, the Dutch, Portuguese, Germans and British drove the development of this region, each with varying success.

Rhodesian Railways is the third game using Winsome’s Regional Railways System. The prior two games were Balkan Railways and Iberian Railways.

Name: Goblin Goldrush
Description:
Goblin Goldrush - A game of tricks, traps, monsters and loot! 2-8 player party game to see which goblin can escape the dungeon with the most gold.

The goblins are on the loose in this frantic family board game! Simple to play and easy to learn, the kids will love this beautifully illustrated and whimsical game. The custom tile map system means every game is a unique experience!

—description from the designer

Name: Zoomalia
Description:
The Zoomalia is a game to play with friends and the whole family.
â€‹
Players will participate in two distinct phases to accumulate the most points. In the first phase, which consists of an Animal Auction, players will purchase animal cards that will be used in the next phase. In the second phase, players must collect the best combination of foods through the Food Market using the cards acquired in the first phase.

The player with the highest score will be the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Vem får sista ordet?
Description:
Vem får sista ordet? is a word game. Each round there will be two cards drawn, one with a letter and one with an category (eg. dishes). After that a timer is started, and all player in clockwise order gonna start say a word that fits the category and also that starts on the given letter. The player that has said the last word when the timers rings move that players pawn one step on the board. The first player that reach goal (takes 13 steps) is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: The Argent Adept – Dark Dynamics
Description:
A promo card for the game Sentinels of the Multiverse.

HP: 23

Power: Reveal the top card of any 2 decks. Put 1 card into play and the other into the trash.

Name: The Beautiful Game:  A Turn-Based Strategy Boardgame
Description:
Step into the shoes of great football coaches and show off your managerial skills.  You will be in charge of every move your team players make, whether an audacious attack or resolute defense.  Test out different formations, based on those of famous football clubs, and find out which one best matches your play style.  In 'The Beautiful Game', players will take turns positioning their players formations, as they tackle, pass, shoot and score, in order to break down the opposing player's defence.

Your turn (as the one with the football) consists of as many 'singular moves' as possible, plus one 'multi-move' based on your designated formation.  Moving the ball carefully, you will seek to pass to your teammates and look for opportunities to shoot & score on the goal.

Name: COMBO TRAX
Description:
COMBO TRAX is a fighting game for 2 players using the mechanisms of a climbing game. Each player starts the game with 20 HP, and when a player passes, they will take damage based upon the last card(s) played by their opponent. They will also increase their power gauge.

Further, each player has special techniques that can be triggered depending upon the suits of the cards played, with the suits representing the buttons that would've been hit in an arcade game.  Players may also be able to overlap the suits so as to make combos of their moves.

The first player to eliminate their opponent wins, or play best 2 out of 3.

Name: Anastyr: The Fog of Revolt
Description: The Fog of Revolt expansion (set in the Kingdom of Stone-Hills region), which again offers you a FULL environment, with all the figures and tiles related to this adventure that the Companions of the Spear will live. Note that if you take this expansion, the 5 scenarios (3 scenarios + 1 Mini-Boss scenario + 1 Boss scenario) included will be part of the full campaign. But this remains optional and you can still play the campaign without this expansion. In other words, the campaign will adapt to the expansions you have: it will offer ellipses and an experience system adapted to the expansions you own besides the Core Box. Also note that the Core Box will contain 4 regions: Jade Sea, Forge and Anastyr’s Fortress (already in the Core Box) + 1 region (Bone Swamp) that will be unlocked as stretch goals (it will by the end of the campaign!). That’s a total for this Core Box campaign of 18 scenarios.

Name: Anastyr: The All-Mother's Secret
Description: The Primordial Jungles are home to the densest forests of Alboraan. Legend has it that this mysterious, impenetrable land was seeded from the tears of the All-Mother weeping over her people, slaughtered by dragons in ancient times. The forests are so dense that light rarely reaches the ground. An inextricable network of lianas and branches makes any progression hostile and laborious. In the shadows lurk the terrible saber-toothed tigers and immense carnivorous plants.Few are those who dare to penetrate this compact green danger zone  and make contact with the fierce tribes living near the ancient temples of their ancestors. But they are also the guardians of the black lotus, a flower with extraordinary properties... The Companions of the Spear know that this flower would be an unparalleled asset in the fight against the forces of Anastyr, but this quest comes at a cost. The powerful Tanit, known as the goddess of the jungle, reigns supreme over this trade and convincing her will not be easy. In addition, the goddess who claims to be the reincarnation of the All-Mother herself is waging her own war against the tribes who refuse to join her cult, and in particular against Karanja, her main rival.

Name: Anastyr: The Necromancer's Plague
Description:
The Bone Swamp lies between the Jade Sea and the Dark Swamp. This territory is named after the megadons who have lived in this area for centuries. The skeletons of their ancestors can be seen above the stagnant waters and in some places they look like open graveyards. The region is inhabited by the "Primitives," a fierce people who worship the All-Mother and consider themselves her children. The Primitives, also known as the Firstborn, consider the swamp to be sacred ground. They are also the guardians of the megadons, whose survival they have ensured over the centuries, despite the presence of dragons that frequently preyed on their eggs.

The region is inhabited by the "Primitives," a fierce people who worship the All-Mother and consider themselves her children. The Primitives, also known as the Firstborn, consider the swamp to be sacred ground. They are also the guardians of the megadons, whose survival they have ensured over the centuries, despite the presence of dragons that frequently preyed on their eggs. Each tribe was born in the wake of one of these ancestral creatures, whose name it has taken. Over the centuries, the tribe watches over the offspring of "their" megadon and ensures that it matures safe from predators. The primitive tribes live in lakeside villages. The matriarch's home is always found at the center of these villages, where wood is mixed with the remains of the ancestral megadon's egg. The Firstborn communication uses very specific tongue clicks, which allows them to hunt over large areas and to implement their battle plans against their enemies.

When moving through the swamps, the Primitives use stilts, the length of which determines their social position within the tribe. To travel longer distances, they ride Kurdai, mounts imported from the High Plains centuries ago. Today, kurdai are found in most village enclosures but also in the wild, as they have become an endemic animal of the swamps.

Unfortunately, an unprecedented threat has been looming over the Bone Swamp for nearly twenty years: the Plague. This disease corrupts living creatures, both animals and humans. In its final stage, the infected become rabid and kill each other. The Firstborn fear that the megadon eggs will also fall victim to this terrifying disease, especially since some of them are regularly traded during the passage of the Great Caravan, in exchange for iron and precious stones... These extremely precious eggs are indeed sought after by all the caravan masters, to enlarge their convoy and ensure their prosperity.

Name: Rex
Description:
This is a track game, copyright 1888, with "safety tracks" (turnouts) on each side. In fact, it almost exactly resembles the board layout of Parker Brothers' later games Pollyanna and The Popular Game of Broadway. The only real difference is that there are no "home" paths branching off of the main track. Instead, players start pieces off on their "entrance" space (the board corner in front of them) and make a single loop of the board, returning pieces to the entrance space and then moving them to the center of the board, called the "court."

THe game is first seen in the Parker Games catalog for 1889, on page 5. The ads do not indicate how the game is played, only that it includes "turned maple pieces" and a spinner. Identical listings are found in the 1890 and 1891 catalogs.

By 1892, Rex is being packaged with The Amusing Game of Kilkenny Cats as two sides of a "combination" board game. It is available in this form until 1895.

Name: Chilli or Chunder: Chilli Eating Contest Game
Description:
As chilli eating contestants there are two things you focus on: Eating more chillies than the other contestants. The other... Not chundering!

Over five rounds of ever increasing hotness, you will eat your way through each chilli, bite by bite. You will need to keep down the bites and once the whole chilli is gone, you show your empty mouth before progressing to the next round. Or fall victim to the chilli, either by failing to take the next bite or chundering it back up.

Outlast your fellow contestants to take the crowning glory and become the Chilli or Chunder Champion!

Included is the 5th and 6th contestant expansion "Chilli or Chunder: Hot Stuff", with two new ways to play:

- First Timer (more challenging)
Having never eaten hot stuff chillies before but decided to give the contest a go none the less, this contestant shows determination of steel, but without the matching stomach.

- Professional (less challenging)
A hot stuff chilli eating machine, this contestant should eat up this contest.

—description from the designer

Name: ESHIP: Navigating Uncertainty
Description:
The Game
Players test their team-based decision-making abilities within the safe environment of a game. They role-play, discuss, narrate, and make strategic decisions under uncertain conditions simulated by characters, traits, unforeseen events, team-communication, and time pressure.

Who can play?
Basically anyone with reading and comprehension skills can play. Although created for students of Entrepreneurship, it can be played by novices, experts, educators, entrepreneurs, or anyone who wants to kickstart their own project – for-profit, non-profit, or social.

Who can play?
Basically anyone with reading and comprehension skills can play. Although created for students of Entrepreneurship, it can be played by novices, experts, educators, entrepreneurs, or anyone who wants to kickstart their own project – for-profit, non-profit, or social.

Winning condition
In contrast to many other games, a lower score leads you to success. In a multi-team setting, the team with the lowest uncertainty score wins.

Name: Bardsung: Fables
Description: Kickstarter Exclusive expansion to Bardsung that includes several new heroes, enemies and scenarios to use with the core game

Name: Sunset
Description: In Sunset, players take turns to shape the sunset. Each turn, a player may choose to expand the sky by placing a colored card in a grid. Or, they can place a cloud on a sky card. They may also move the sun token (sideways or down). When the top row is completed, each player chooses a scoring card from their hand. On these cards are descriptions such as “grey clouds in the top row”, “pink cards in the sky” or “clouds on the top row”. The player with the highest scoring card places it in front of them. The top row is removed and the game continues until one player has collected three scoring cards.

Name: Strike HQ
Description:
Strike HQ is a two-player, head-to-head, expandable battle card game that brings the classic thrill of real-time strategy (RTS) video games to the tabletop. 


Starting with only a Headquarters and a handful of units, you play commanders of opposing factions and will use an innovative blend of simultaneous action programming and hidden information mechanics to construct your bases, deploy more units, and launch a strike against the enemy HQ.

The game takes 2 minutes to set up, plays in around one hour, and you win by either destroying your opponent’s HQ through an overwhelming offensive or by sitting back and storing up enough resources to launch a game-ending Atomic Strike!

Gameplay is inspired by classic PC RTS video games of the 1990s like Command & Conquer: Red Alert, and more recently Company of Heroes.

—description from the designer

Name: BattleTech: Battleforce Counters Pack
Description:
Five punchboards representing two armies of nearly eighty Unit and Command counters each.

Two maps that form a large Strategic BattleForce map; laminated, the back side can be used to create your own worlds.

The first ever published, super-sized Inner Sphere at War map (2786 & 3025)

Name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – Dark Age
Description: Technical Readout: Dark Age  expands on Technical Readout: Succession Wars, Technical Readout: Clan Invasion, and Technical Readout: Jihad by combining the ’Mechs previously found in Technical Readout: 3075, Technical Readout: 3085 (and its Supplemental), Technical Readout: 3145, Technical Readout: Irregulars, Technical Readout: Prototypes, and more. This volume features some of the most common ’Mechs from the Dark Age. Each machine is accompanied by an illustration, a description of its history, capabilities, and game stats.

Name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3085 Supplemental
Description: Technical Readout – 3085 Supplemental provides details and gameplay statistics for additional infantry, battle armor, vehicles, 'Mechs, and aerospace units that debuted during the Jihad and its immediate aftermath.

Name: Boxcar Battle
Description: Build the highest scoring trains while preventing your opponents from doing the same. Players are dealt cards with train cars depicted on them including engines, boxcars, tankers, flat cars, and cabooses. Different cars have various abilities that raise or lower the point total of the train onto which it is played. On their turn the player plays one card on any of their trains or an opponents train them chooses another card from the deck. Play continues until all three track cards are discovered from the deck at which time points are totaled.

Name: AIRFLIP
Description:
AIRFLIP is a flip/roll&write game set in an airport. 
Players are in charge of boarding their planes the best possible way while facing picky passengers.

Shuffle the passenger cards and make three piles, flip the first card on their call number side of each pile below them.
Each passenger has a passport value (victory points) and will be able to board your plane if you meet their requirements (some want to seat in the front of the plane, some want to be near an exit, etc...).
Roll your dice and use them to board the passengers you want depending on their call number value (your dice must match or exceed this value).
Plan carefully the boarding of your plan, win bonuses and be the first to board your plane entirely with the most valuable passengers to win the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kick Off: Coach
Description:
Become the coach and manager of your club. Line up the right players in the right positions, build the right tactic deck, manage your team's environment and much more to lead your club to the championship!

Kick Off - Coach can be played over several seasons or for one championship. Each season is divided into match days, during which you can allocate your resources to your various staff and action options: from training, stadium and club infrastructure development to the transfer market and much more. You compete against each other on match days. Kick Off - Coach uses a unique momentum mechanic in combination with a tactical card deck, which challenges you to perfectly coordinate your line-up, tactics, playing style and the stamina of your players.

The game can be played with 1 to 8 players, with easy-to-use bots taking over clubs. Due to the parallel processing of the game days, there is little downtime and the game time is not extended. If you play over several seasons, an additional legacy effect comes into play through the development of the players and the club.

—description from the designer

Name: Oranienburger Kanal: Expansion I
Description:
In the tradition of Uwe's masterpiece Agricola, this game will include a number of expandable card sets which will change and add to your gaming experience.
 The base game will come with two card sets (A & B) but four more sets will become available, adding endless replayability and variety to your games.
 Each Expansion Set is boxed and contains 120 cards (2 sets) plus Glossaries in English and German!

—description from the Gamefound campaign page

Expansion I contains decks C and D for Oranienburger Kanal.

Name: Oranienburger Kanal: Expansion II
Description:
In the tradition of Uwe's masterpiece Agricola, this game will include a number of expandable card sets which will change and add to your gaming experience.
 The base game will come with two card sets (A & B) but four more sets will become available, adding endless replayability and variety to your games.
 Each Expansion Set is boxed and contains 120 cards (2 sets) plus Glossaries in English and German!

–description from the publisher

Expansion II contains decks E and F for Oranienburger Kanal.

Name: Snitches Get Stitches: the card game
Description:
Snitches Get Stitches: the card game, is a game of "Riotous Prison Fun" for 3-6 players ages 13 and up. Players will recruit "gang members" and collect "contraband" in order to reduce their prison sentence and get out of prison first. Shanking other players, stealing their contraband, or encouraging their gang members to defect are all useful strategies to win. This turn-based card game gives players the opportunity to collect sets of contraband, trade with other players, and cheat, steal or lie their way to the finish.

Just remember, "he who shanks last, shanks best!"

—description from the publisher

Name: Machi Koro: Millionaire's Row Event Construction Kit
Description:
è¡—ã‚³ãƒ­ã‚·ãƒ£ãƒ¼ãƒ— (which translates as "Machi Koro Sharp") expands the Machi Koro base game with thirteen new establishment cards, including a winery, a moving company and a general store. The designer notes that the new cards somewhat increase the difficulty of the rules, and this expansion can be combined with Machi Koro: Harbor Expansion.

è¡—ã‚³ãƒ­ã‚·ãƒ£ãƒ¼ãƒ— contains 72 cards: six copies each of the ten red, blue, and green establishments and four copies each of the three purple major establishments.

Name: Kuddly Kymera
Description:
Play cards from your hand to create the cutest animal for yourself and leave your opponents with a hideous monster! Modifier cards rule, like a rainbow tail for bonus points to you or scaly skin to an opponent for negative points. Appropriate for all ages.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dualing Dice
Description:
Dualing Dice is a new strategy dice board game from Mythica Gaming in which 2 to 4 players face off by rolling two dice at a time in a duel to be the first to complete their goals.

You can choose your pair of dice to maximize the odds, or you can pick your favorites and take your chances with Lady Luck. Select your own roll, or steal an opponent's to interrupt their strategy. Play a light, friendly game or a cut-throat battle... it all depends on the players at the table.

The first player to earn 15 points by completing their goal card conditions wins the game—but everyone’s a winner when they get to roll dice!

—description from the publisher

Name: Escape Box: Pirates
Description:
Embark on a fabulous adventure aboard a pirate ship! The Pirate Captain lands on an abandoned island and leaves you 45 minutes to find the lost treasure of Pirate Buzzard.

It will be necessary to do quickly, because the Captain will not leave you a minute more! Time is running out, will you solve the riddles and bring back the loot to save you from the clutches of these dangerous pirates?

Recreate the atmosphere of an escape room at home! You have 45 minutes to find clues concealed by the Master of the Game that will allow you to solve all the puzzles.

Name: My First Adventure: The Wreck-it Race
Description:
Today, it’s a free-for-all!
Today, you’re going to race head-on into a crazy Grand Prix!

Who do you want to be in this race?

     Ambrose aboard “Tanky”, her armored tank.
     Bip-Bop, in his “Futuro-Mobile”, a technological masterpiece.
     Haru commanding “Red Lightning”, his super race car!


Choose carefully, as in this rather unusual story, your choices make the difference between winning and losing.

The Wreck-it Race is the fifth book in the My First Adventure collection of stories in which you are the tiny hero.

Name: Pie Y'all
Description:
Try not to get pied in this game of Pie Y'all from Ridley's Games!

In this fun-filled, family-friendly twist on the classic game of Sh*thead, don't be the one left with pie on your face!

On your turn, try to play a card of equal or higher value if you can, and if not you need to pick up the entire discard pile.

The object of the game is to not be the last person to be rid of all your cards, so you'll want to try to give away as much pie as possible!

Be sure to keep a pie out for several upper crust cards like the Key Lime Pie-rate and the Lemon Buff Pastry!

Perfect for pie enthusiasts, families, and groups of friends, it comes in a sweet pie illustrated tin and is suitable for ages 8+, 2-5 players, and has an average 15 minute gameplay.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dice Hospital: ER – Emergency Roll: VIPs Promo
Description:
VIPs: Very Important Patients is a mini-expansion for Dice Hospital: ER - Emergency Roll. It gives every player a chance to score additional points by admitting an extra-special patient to their hospital and matching the VIP's specific preferences.

It is 6-card expansion included in the Dice Theme Park and Dice Hospital: ER - Emergency Roll Promo Pack #2.

Name: Stomp The Monster
Description:
See who's the best at monster spotting in this snap card game Stomp the Monster from Ridley's Games!

You and your friends are out searching for the elusive Stomp, the Monster. But on your trek, you've lost your batteries and only have one working camera between you all!

The aim of the game is to be the first player to find two batteries and have the camera in front of you to snap a picture of Stomp to win!

As you play, you'll want to try to collect batteries by either getting a double battery card or winning a snap on a numbered card that features batteries on it, as when you do you get to keep that battery card. And each time there is a snap, the camera card moves to the next player. So you'll want to have collected two batteries and have the camera card in front of you when the Stomp card comes up, for if you do, you've won!

Packaged in a sasquatch style container, this game is perfect for families and groups of friends, for Halloween or year-round monster fun!

—description from the publisher

Name: Dice Theme Park: Medic Administrator Promo Card
Description:
Included in the Dice Theme Park and Dice Hospital: ER - Emergency Roll Promo Pack.

The medic administrator for Dice Theme Park - which returns any colour dice that is leaving your park back to your entrance at a value of 4

Name: Adulting
Description:
Get ready for a hilarious night in for fully groan-up adults with Adulting from Ridley's Games!

Finally, a game where you're rewarded for when you do the dishes straight away and show up to work on time!

First, pick a badge randomly and read it to yourself without showing the other players. Then, it's time to put those hustling skills you earned working three jobs to cover off rent and your cat's deluxe silk bed and organic food subscription to use!

Do ANYTHING you can think of to EARN that badge while other players try to guess what achievement your badge is for. This isn't charades though -- you can speak, makeâ€¯noise and use nearby stuff like furniture, props, andâ€¯even people!

The player who has earned the most badges and pins by the end of the game is the ultimate adult!

Perfect for millennials and any other adults who still don't know how to throw a proper dinner party, it's suitable for 3-5 players and has an average 20 minute gameplay. Can be played with roommates in your shared apartment, at the dinner table in your parent's house, or at your married friend's three-bedroom bungalow.

-description from publisher

Name: Awk-Word
Description:
Act fast and shout out in the game of Awk-Word from Ridley's Games!

In this hella cool game, you'll want to collect the most chips by shouting words really fast.

So what's the 411? After the dice have been rolled, players takeâ€¯turns shoutingâ€¯wordsâ€¯that fitâ€¯aâ€¯topic. For example, if the topic isâ€¯PIZZA TOPPINGS, you might shout “Pepperoni"â€¯orâ€¯"Olives"â€¯orâ€¯“Anchovies” BUT you can’tâ€¯shout a word thatâ€¯begins with any of the letters showing on theâ€¯dice! When you shout a valid answer that the referee approves, you get to take a chip.

But be quick with your answers (like, two seconds max), because if the referee feels you're taking too long, they can ring the Awk-Word bell on you and you'll be out for that round! You'll be totally buggin, but don't worry, you'll be able to play again in the next round.

Playâ€¯continues untilâ€¯each playerâ€¯has beenâ€¯the referee three times, and if you have the most chips, you win! Booyah!

Perfect for groups of friends, families and 90s lovers, it's suitable for ages 13+, 2-7 players and has an average 15 minute gameplay.

-description from publisher

Name: Draw It, See It, Say It
Description:
Draw,â€¯memorize,â€¯or bluff your way to victory in Draw It, See It, Say It from Ridley's Games!

In this awesome party game trio that will have everyone guessing, there's three ways to play: drawing, seeing, or saying.

Roll the dice and take a categoryâ€¯card that matches the color shown on the dice. Pink means it's time to test your artistic skills, and the player then needs to draw one of the two prompts (easy or hard) with all other players guessing what it is.

Yellow puts your memory to the test, with the player trying to memorize and then recall the color of one of the symbols on the card randomly selected by another player.

Green will test your bluffing skills, with the player trying to convince the other players whether or not they're being truthful about what's on the card.

The game ends when any player has won 3 cards of each color, and the player with the most points is the winner!

Perfect for families and groups of friends, it's suitable for ages 8+, 2-8 players, and has an average of 30 minute gameplay.

-description from publisher

Name: Grab A Slice
Description:
Get a pizza' the action with Grab A Slice from Ridley's Games!

In this supreme pizza game with all the tasty toppings, try to win points by rolling the dice to match the good type of toppings on a pizza card.

Start by grabbing a slice card that could come in handy later! Then, roll as many times as you like to try to win a pizza card, hopefully rolling enough of the good ingredients pictured in order to win it! But other players may challenge you for that pizza card! And if you roll too many of the bad ingredients listed, you'll go bust for that turn!

But beware, at the end of the game, the leading player rolls a die one final time to select a topping -- the player who grabbed the slice with that topping at the start of the game gets bonus points, and could potentially come out in the lead!

The player with the most points wins the game as the ultimate pizza aficiona-dough!

Freshly delivered in a pizza style box, it's perfect for pizza lovers or anyone who loves a cheesy party game. With gameplay for both small and large groups, it's suitable for ages 8+, 2-6 players and has an average 30 minute gameplay. Printed on FSC paper using vegetable inks.

-description from publisher

Name: Paint the Roses: The Caterpillar Module
Description:
This module is best played with the Escape the Castle expansion rules and components.

In order to win, you need to achieve the module objective without being caught by the Queen.

Playing with the expansion?
Setup the game as per the Escape the Castle rules using the Caterpillar Helper cards.

Playing without the expansion?
Setup the game as per the Paint the Roses rules.
Place the 8 Caterpillar helper cards back in the box.

Your objective is to create high places for the Caterpillar to relax and view the garden.

Name: Rabbit vs Bondsman
Description:
Rabbit vs Bondsman is a modern-day cat & mouse board game that the entire family will enjoy. In the game a fugitive known as 'Rabbit' has jumped bail, and John, the bondsman, has hired Bounty Hunters to retrieve him. Therefore, the game pits the Rabbit against 1 to 3 Bounty Hunters.

The goal of the game differs between the Rabbit and the Bounty Hunters. The Rabbit's goal is to collect funds from his stash houses or jobs while evading the bounty hunter(s), and the Bounty Hunters goal is to capture the Rabbit before they run out of money.

It is a roll and move game that's quick pace and fun, and also features a set of cards that directs the players of their actions.

There are three different options for playing, so the fun can last anywhere from 30 minutes to three hours. Only one question remains: Will you be the Bondsman or the Rabbit? Your fate will be decided by the roll of the die.

Name: My First Adventure: The Queen of Daisy Dell
Description:
Today, you wake up after long months of hibernation.
Today, you leave the nest to start your own hive!

What future queen do you want to be?

     Bizzcotte, the powerful and reckless worker?
     Or Bizzou, The fine, smart nanny?


Choose your character and enter a story like no other, a story where each of your choices changes your adventure !

The Queen of Daisy Dell is the sixth book in the "My First Adventure" collection of stories in which you are the tiny hero.

Name: Argentina (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
Description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

Name: My First Adventure: The Egg Snatcher
Description:
Today, a terrible egg theft has just been committed!
Today, you’re going to turn the town upside down to find the culprit!

Who do you want to be for this investigation?


     Zoé, the mouse?
     Jeppy, the bear?
     Or Nouki, the raccoon?


Choose your character and enter a story like no other, a story where each of your choices changes your adventure!

The Egg Snatcher is the seventh book in the "My First Adventure" collection of stories in which you are the tiny hero.

Name: Rocket Ranchers: Herding Cats in Space!
Description:
Welcome to Planet Binxadinx!

Rocket Ranchers is a set-collection game about collecting animals for your ranch using your dogship cards to "beam up" animals from various biomes across the planet. The collected animals will be placed in available pens on your ranch. Each pen can hold only one type of animal. The more of a single species you collect, the more profitable your ranch will be. Collect only a few of a species, and you might lose money.

While collecting animals, you'll also encounter space cats, which will cling to some of the animals you collect. Collect one or a bunch to earn points. Collect a few or none, and you'll lose points.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Clue: Dexter
Description:
Miami Metro PD is on the hunt for a homicidal monster, but another unseen threat is at large.

Will following the clues allow law enforcement to protect the city, or will the criminal succumb to a different kind of justice?

Get behind the badges of Debra Morgan, Maria Laguerta, Angel Batista, Vince Masuka, James Doakes, and Joey Quinn to scope out locations around Miami.

You must determine WHICH serial killer is accountable, WHO will apprehend them, and WHERE they’ll be caught!

Contents:
1 Game Board
6 Investigator Movers
6 Personality Cards
21 Rumor Cards
25 Intrigue Cards
6 Killer Tokens
Custom Score Pad
2 Dice
Envelope
Rules

-description from publisher
Families: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)

Name: Operation Martlet: Objective Barracuda
Description:
June 1944: On the right flank of Operation EPSOM, the British set up Operation MARTLET. This operation was necessary because EPSOM was vulnerable to German counterattack from the high ground in the Rauray area. It was essential for the Allies to seize several key points prior to the launching of EPSOM. These key points were the villages of Rauray, Fontenay-le-Pesnel, Tessel, Brettevillette, and Juvigny.

The 49th (West Riding) Infantry Division, consisting of the 70th, 146th and 147th Infantry Brigades, as well as the 8th Armoured Brigade, was assigned to carry out MARTLET. The operation’s first objective was BARRACUDA, the road between Juvigny and Fontenay. The German forces in this sector consisted of the Panzer Lehr Division and the 12.SS-Panzer-division Hitlerjugend (Hilter Youth).

Objective: BARRACUDA offers two ways of experiencing the battle. Players can sample a portion of the fighting by playing one of eight standalone scenarios. Scenarios FLP1-FLP8 also serve to familiarize players with the battlefield and the opposing forces. Players who enjoy a strategic aspect are encouraged to experience the entire battle by playing the Tactical Mission (TM). The TM is comprised of five inter-connected scenarios that begin the morning (0900 hours) of 25 June and continue over the course of four additional time periods: 1100, 1300, 1600, and 2100 hours. The TM lends itself well to team play.

Contains:
One 35" x 24" map with one inch hexes
One countersheet
Chapter Obj:B rules
Eight ASL scenarios
One Campaign Games

Name: Spells
Description:
Quest across the wild lands to the Magic Tree! Cast Spells along the way, conjuring helpful tools while encountering curious and enchanted characters .

Spells is a hex-grid, pick-up and deliver, open draft, race-ish adventure word game. Players take turns traversing the magical wild lands, spelling words and making tricky decisions about whether to race to the end or go on side quests.

You will cultivate Magic as you Spell words out. This Magic will be counted at the end to determine a winner. But it can also be used to conjure a Broomstick to move further, a Wand to transform consonants into vowels, as well as a Charm, Crystal Ball, Familiar, and Friendly Spirit.

Magic can also be earned by meeting the requirements of the various Helpers you'll meet along the way. The Coven of witches need a Spell with a 'Q' in it for their recipe. You can sneak past the Sleeping Giant if your Spell contains the letters 'SH'.

Everyone will have a different adventure traveling the lands of Spells.

—description from the designer

Name: A game about counting cats' shapes and colours, that keeps getting trickier.
Description:
Each turn, someone flips over a card!

Card backs show uncoloured cats, or scribbled colours. Fronts show 3 cats, coloured in red or purple.

The newly-revealed back tells you what shape(s) or colour to count. First to yell the number and slap the card wins that card, or loses everything if they were wrong.

Each card you win is more cats to count!

First to 5 cards wins!

Normally, the first slapper becomes the flipper for the next round and cannot compete. In the 2-player variants, players take turns flipping a card from the deck and they can both compete.

The main restriction for the upper playercount is the number of players able to reach the flipped card to slap it.

—description from the designer

Name: Etno
Description:
Up to 4 players collect and place tiles in this board game inspired by Bulgarian embroidery and ancient symbols. Create patterns, fulfill objectives and become the winner thanks to good planning, creativity an spatial thinking.
You collect tiles from the market, activate actions place tiles on the board or keep them for later and win points by achieving symmetry, color and shape objectives.

Name: Kriegsspiel
Description:
Kriegsspiel is a modern revision of the original Kriegsspiel rules. The game retains the basic elements of Kriegsspiel that make the game so remarkable, such as double-blind play, umpired, simultaneous resolution of orders, delayed order implementation, dispatch transmission, and emphasis on fog of war.

The game is simple and easy to learn, and features modifications for two-player play. Its complexity is between 1867 Kriegsspiel and Free Kriegsspiel.

Play takes place on a scaled map with pieces that represent the space formations would occupy on the battlefield. Typically, three maps are used, and play proceeds in double-blind fashion, facilitated by an umpire, but two-player play on a single map is also possible.

Combat is resolved by die rolls and consulting a CRT, although results may be modified by the umpire at their reasoned discretion.

Name: Galactic Conquest
Description:
1-4 player lite strategy game.  Collect resources, build ships, and attack the opponent's base in a 1v1 or 2v2 team battle.  Play against human or bot players.

Each turn, players will choose 2 cards from their order deck and play them face-down. After all cards have been played, reveal the order cards and each player will execute their cards in order specified by the number on the card with the lowest order card starting first.

When the same order card is played, the player or team with their initiative token takes their turn first. If the game has teams, matching order cards are executed in alternating team order starting with the team that has the initiative token.

The game ends when a player or team's base has reached 0 health. The other player or team wins the game.

Name: Veney
Description:
Veney is a chesslike game for two players designed to invoke the mechanics and spirit of a sword fight. The goal is to use your blade piece to checkmate your opponent either by touch (taking the Self piece) or by disarm (taking their only blade piece) while defending against checkmate in return. On your turn, you can move one of your pieces to an open square, move to take an opponent's piece or "fend" it (sending it to their reserve), place one of your reserved pieces on an open square, withdraw a piece, pass, or use various special moves and aspects of the pieces in play.

Many of the core elements of chess are inverted, removed, or altered to more closely resemble corresponding aspects of fencing. For example, there is no check, and two-way checkmates are possible. There are multiple methods by which a player can make two moves at once, and a wide array of special moves allows for unpredictable ripostes. The 4x16 board is subdivided lengthwise into four "measures" which allow for unique piece movements and flexible range constraints. Positions can get exceedingly complex, and breaking the rules (knowingly or not) is incorporated into the game as a potential grounds for disarmament or sudden-death.

A veney set is made up of collected rocks and trinkets which players cultivate and trade over time. "Token" pieces are won and lost as prizes at the conclusion of a formal game.

—description from the designer

Name: SavannaScapes
Description:
Players take turns moving around the play area choosing species tiles and placing them next to others to provide those species with their needed habitats and create an ecosystem.

Point tokens are earned each time a player meets the needs of their animals or when an event tail is played. The player with the most points when all the rounds are complete wins.

Name: Riot Police Commander: Assault! Asama Mountain Lodge
Description:
Riot Police Commander: Assault! Asama Mountain Lodge is a one-person exercise kit that deals with the final phase of the Asama Mountain Lodge incident, the hostage rescue operation on February 28, 1972.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asama-SansÅ_incident

As the on-site commander, the player aims to completely control Asama Mountain Lodge. The exercise system refers to Avalon Hill's Squad Leader, especially for "units", "command ability" and "morale" in order to recreate the commander's influence, which was particularly noticeable in actual rescue operations.

In addition, the "Storm over System" (Area Impulse) was incorporated in the reproduction of the important aspect of "riot police battle", which is "eliminating barricades while suppressing extremists with water cannons and gas cylinders".

And besides, since the event cards reflect the "sudden incident" that occurred in the Asama Mountain Lodge incident, its impact can also be verified.

Name: Vilniaus pramonės istorijos
Description:
Develop industry in XIX-XX c. Vilnius through different eras: rivers, rail and modern.
Each turn player will draw limited resources from the bag, and use them to build factories. Besides victory points factories allow to get production needed for other factories, to fulfill orders and long term projects. You can use factories of your opponents to help fulfil your orders faster, but you will give them extra resources.
Best industry developer wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Rogue-class Starfighter Expansion Pack
Description:
X-Wing 2nd ed.: Rogue-class Starfighter Expansion Pack contains everything you need to add two Rogue-class Starfighters to your Separatist or Scum and Villainy squadrons, including a beautifully painted miniature in the traditional Magnaguard color scheme, and another in the distinctive scheme of Xanadu Blood, the personal ship of notorious bounty hunter Cad Bane. The expansion also has four maneuver dials (two for each faction), and an assortment of tokens. Additionally, thirteen ship cards let you choose the pilots who fly this iconic starfighter into battle and seventeen upgrade cards invite you to customize your ship to fit your strategy.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Cave-In
Description: The year is 1602 and the bank extends you a 50 pound loan. In a race against time and the elements, you venture into the world of mining. Drill, dig, smelt, sell, and keep ahead of your bank loan as you strive to strike it rich. Weigh your odds carefully before excavating to maximize profit while avoiding a CAVE-IN!

Name: Etna: Fires of Sicily
Description:
Trapped under Mt. Etna & chased by an ancient Sicilian philosopher, Players must use their unique abilities, manipulate the tomb and find artifacts to escape before the entire tomb collapses with them inside!

Players take turns moving their explorers through the maze to find the four needed keys to escape the labyrinth. They must bring them to the other side of the labyrinth to unlock the exit and run back to the exit before the volcano drops down on them!

Each room has a different ability or instant action the players can use; both can be good or bad, and they won't know until they enter!

Players have multiple routes to move through and can use several abilities; the ability of the room they occupy, their unique ability, or they can search for artifacts that give them a one-time use ability. Or they can rotate a room to block the philosopher's way.

At the end of each player's turn, the Philosopher moves closer to the explorers. If he ever catches up with a player, a curse tracker moves toward a round tracker, giving him more movement each round; the trackers ever meet its game over!

At the end of a full round of players, the round tracker moves toward the curse tracker on the numbered board. If they ever touch, it's game over!

Once the exit is opened, the rooms fall apart behind them, flipping them over to the destroyed side. They all must rush back to the exit before they are trapped forever!

Name: Elevator Pitch
Description:
Players create and deliver Elevator pitches by associating concepts from pairs of Tech Deck cards. Players present a 1 to 3-minute pitch for a new product, service or project in a causal party game setting. Then, other players get to ask two questions about the pitch just delivered. Play in idea or competitive mode. An Elevator Pitch is a brief speech outlining an idea for a product, service or project. The name comes from the notion that the speech would be delivered in the short time period of an elevator ride. In the financial world, it is an entrepreneur's presentation to a venture capitalist to persuade them that a business idea is worth investing in.

OBJECTIVE – The objective is to create and deliver Elevator Pitches by associating concepts on pairs of Tech Deck cards.
THEME – The theme of the game is an entrepreneur creating the concept for a new product, service or company in modern era setting.
GAME PLAY – The players form teams if playing with more than 4 players. Pairs of concept cards from the Tech Deck are dealt to the table and players/teams get to select a pair of cards from which to create a concept for. Elevator pitches are delivered. Then, the other players get to ask the presenter two questions. In idea mode, the game ends after 10 pitches have been given. In competitive mode, other players vote on whether to fund the idea.
WINNING – In idea mode, there are no winners/losers. In competitive mode, the team/player with the most funded ideas wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Vexagon
Description:
In this move-and-capture game, simple rules lead to complex play. Up to six players race to get their pieces across a hexagonal field of play. The direction and distance of each move is set by the throw of two dice. You can obstruct your opponents by jumping over their pieces and sending them back to the start, but the evil twist is that you can choose to move another player's piece rather than your own. So for example player A might move player B's piece backwards, capturing one of player C's pieces in the process.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Refined Lantern Sword
Description:
Glossary Card, Gear Card and Weapon Proficiency Card that were included with the Willow First Run Collector's Edition that was not part of the based game.

The First Run Collector's Edition is enclosed in a hand-stamped kraft box includes:

Photoresin Willow
1 x Hard Plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round insert and base
Large Matte Art Print
Character Art Card
Beta Rules - 1 x Glossary Card, 1 x Gear Card, 1 Weapon Proficiency Card
First run collector's edition: Signed and numbered authenticity note
DeathGrey edition limited to 250: Deathgrey authenticity note
DeathPink Edition limited to 400: Deathpink authenticity note

White Box Edition Contents:
Seed Pattern - Willow is packaged in a graphic box that includes:

1 x Seed Pattern - Willow hard plastic miniature
1 x Hard plastic Kingdom Death 30mm base and insert
1 x Seed pattern card
1 x Seed pattern gear card
1 x Living rules glossary card
1 x Novel Sword weapon proficiency card
1 x Large matte art print

Willow is the most talented swordmaster to appear in generations. Her adaptability, sense of balance, and inventiveness have taken the lives of many and captured the attention of more. The Hand itself has taken an interest. It waits patiently to either best her in combat, or for her life to end so that he may soak a memory quill in her brain. The Scribe is always pleased to add new techniques to the corpse-filled library.

For best experience, use with Gambler's Chest expansion.

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Ashen Shears and Cleavage X
Description:
Glossary Card and Gear Card that were included with the Pascha First Run Collector's Edition that was not part of the based game.

The First Run Collector's Edition is enclosed in a hand-stamped kraft box includes:

Photoresin Pascha
1 x Hard Plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round insert and base
Large Matte Art Print
Character Art Card
Beta Rules - 1 x Glossary Card, 1 x Gear Card
First run collector's edition: Signed and numbered authenticity note
Deathgrey edition limited to 250: Deathgrey authenticity note

Pascha is a survivor from a settlement that primarily hunts Ashen Lagomorphs, also known as Milk Rabbits. What they lack in intelligence, they make up for in viscousness and a high capacity to breed. Milk Rabbits never stop growing, and their appetite increases with their size. Most die from madness, others from their front teeth getting so long they curl under their chin and cut their jugular.

Milk Rabbits have poor eyesight and scent, wearing fabrics and makeup made from their fur and fat is a great way to confuse them while on the hunt.

Pascha’s shears are specially made to cut dense Milk Rabbit fur that is so fluffy and matted it acts as a layer of armor!

Her settlement lives in fear and respect for the monster, often holding festivals to promote health, fertility, and a healthy body.

Name: MetroX: Extention Map Pack – Sapporo & Kobe & Kyoto
Description:
In MetroX, players create subway networks by filling in the station spaces on their individual game sheets. Using the numbers revealed by the cards, all players fill up their subway map with â—¯s in the station spaces. However, the number of times they can add stations to each line is limited, so they have to make tough choices. Players can score many points by getting their star bonuses in stations with many intersecting routes. Players also get bonuses by being the first to complete routes. Try to fill in all your stations to minimize the penalties and achieve a high score!

MetroX: Sapporo & Kobe & Kyoto includes three different maps to use with the rules in MetroX. Various gimmicks also appear, such as Kyoto with the largest number of lines, Sapporo with a ring road, Kobe with a huge station...

Name: Dragons with Rocket Launchers
Description:
It's a peaceful summer's day on Dragon Island... or is it? A case of rocket launchers just washed onto shore!

Dragons with Rocket Launchers is a card game of frantically shooting rockets while fending off rockets coming in the player's direction. Each turn, a card is played affecting the state of the battlefield. When a Rocket Time card is played, all the rockets in play will move around the table and potentially eradicate some players.

Be the last dragon standing to win Dragons with Rocket Launchers!

—description from the designer

Name: 18Namibia
Description:
18Namibia is a railway construction and share game for 3 to 4 players. Historical specifications have been taken into account as far as possible. In other places, history should and must be rewritten. Its based on 1895-Namibia from Adam Romoth and Helmut Ohley which was 2004 published.
Players invest in railway companies. The companies create a railway network with track tiles on the game board and run these routes with their trains and generate income. The player with the most shares in a railway company is its director. He decide whether these incomes will be distributed to the shareholders as a dividend or whether it will be added to the companies' treasury for future investments. The progress of time and technical development is shown with 9 train types/devices from 2 to 16.
As with many games in this series, there are similarities within the rules, but many feature slight differences, and it is these that give each individual 18xx game its character.
18Namibia features an interesting array of differences described above.
These include obligations, mines are corporations, quick train rush, 9 H-Train types and other things.

When developing 18Namibia, attention was paid to a short playing time. A game lasts about 180 minutes. A "short variant" (90 minutes) is already finished and only needs to be prepared!

Helmut Ohley

Name: The Rank Game
Description:
Each round: One player is the ranker, and other players are guessers.

Whichever guesser comes closest to the ranker’s choices wins. It couldn’t be easier.  Play one round, or many!

Name: Lamentations of the Marsh Hag
Description:
An evil hag, slain by heroes in times of old, has risen in MurkWaters again to wreak havoc.
I this card-based expansion for Four against Darkness, instead of rolling on tables to generate places and encounters, the player(s) draw cards from a deck and apply the results to the adventure.

The deck contains:
    17 tarot-size, full color cards
    Instructions are included on the cards
    2 unique monster cards
    2 unique magic item cards

Name: Hazardous Movement Scenario Pack 1: A World at War
Description:
Hazmo's debut scenario pack, A World at War, consists of 10 scenarios compatible with the Advanced Squad Leader game system. A description of each scenario is detailed on the image of the back cover above. A wide variety of combatants (including - but not limited to - Russians, Germans, SS, Free French, British, Italians, Japanese and Chinese) and terrain types (including city, bocage, countryside, hill and village) will challenge even seasoned players' skills, while the high fun and replay potential of each scenario will provide you with unmatched value for your purchase. Finally, reliable player support on this website will supply you with answers to any questions you may have. In this way, Hazmo aims to optimize your gaming experience!

—description from the publisher

Name: Simple Space Ship System
Description:
A miniatures focused wargame with simple rules for space opera style armada versus armada combat, for any number of players. The game emphasizes and promotes players to make their own miniatures to represent their armadas, using any material they have available at any skill level.

Players start the game by allocating a number of unit points to create an armada compliment to battle with. Each player has the same unit value. Players take turns making actions with up to 5 ships of their ship, and an additional 2 with a special rule. They roll multiple six-sided dice to determine if ships become damaged. Once a ship takes 4 damage tokens it is destroyed. The game is played until one person surrenders or all of their units are destroyed.

The game is distributed as a book with no components, and players are encouraged to source pieces from gaming shops. Simple Space Ship is played on a field of any size, any foregoes all movement measurement mechanics. Players are free to move their units to any position they choose, simulating very fast moving spacecraft.

The book contains the rules of play, as well as a chart which tracks play over multiple gameplay sessions through it's legacy mechanic.

—description from the publisher

Name: Planetary Profiteers
Description:
Ad astra ad lucrum! You each represent a different culture from a solar system where competition for dominance among your peoples has been the norm for centuries. Now rivals have come together (barely) to send your team on a voyage to negotiate with worlds new to you to build an interplanetary confederation and earn commissions.

You are each in this for yourselves, yet you will somehow have to work together to complete missions. The player with the highest commission point total at the end of the game is the winner.

Name: The Color Scheme
Description:
The Color Scheme is a game of memory, maneuvers and manipulations.

In this 2-player game each player attempts to be the first to decipher a color code that was created by their opponent.   A sharp focus is essential for each successful move.  Players have to try and not be distracted by the shifting of cubes. Each opponent is scheming to outwit the other. The winning player will have to stay one step ahead to win!

Elegantly designed with a real wood game board and player pieces, the game also includes a drawstring bag == all stored within a magnetic flap-front box.

—description from the publisher

Name: Potion Making
Description:
You inherit the old potion shop from your ancestors. now, it is a great timing of potion making!!

Potion Making …plays like a roll-and-write dice game, but without dice. It is a Flip-and-write game.

Representative reveal a material card from the top of the deck. These materials are appeared as primary number. You refer that number and take an action to your own sheet. 
You may try to make a BINGO line, or use that number to upgrade Magical Pots.ã€€You can also “compound” new numbers.

Because of the communal actions, game play is simultaneous. It means that, Potion Making is playable for large groups of players.

Name: Clash of Carriers: The Battle of the Philippine Sea
Description:
The Battle of Midway was fought between seven carriers. Compare this to the Battle of the Philippine Sea which featured a total of 24 carriers on both sides! It was simply the largest carrier battle of all time which will never be surpassed.

Clash of Carriers, by designer Mark Stille, portrays this epic battle. The historical result saw the Japanese carrier force shattered, never to recover for the rest of the war. While this showdown is almost always treated as a one-sided affair, in this game players will have every opportunity to better the historical outcome or maybe even even reverse history.

The Japanese player can use the superior range of his carrier- and land-based aircraft in coordinated waves to hit the US Navy while his fleet maneuvers out of US aircraft range. Historically, despite poor aircraft coordination, many Japanese aircraft broke through the US fighter screen to attack US carriers. What could better coordination accomplish?

The American player can opt for an offensive strategy with a number of task groups to try and inflict even more massive losses on the Japanese naval force instead of settling for defeating the Japanese air strikes. US submarines inflicted losses and tracked Japanese fleet movements -- can they do so again, or will Japanese counter-measures foil historical results?

Against the Odds #58 (January 2023)

Name: Geen JA geen NEE: mini spel
Description:
You say Yes or No more often then you think.

But in this game this will be punished immediately. Your opponents try's to get a Yes or No by asking smart questions.

But if you keep a clear head and answer clever, you win the card.

Who has the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Name: Danger Bingo
Description:
Imagine the classic format – a room full of fun-loving people, each with their own bingo card, a lively caller wielding a rotating bingo ball machine. Now this is where it gets interesting. The timeless bingo calls have all been updated *gasp* with a series of outlandish forfeits!

The bingo game where the more you win, the more you lose
Classic bingo calls have been turned into hilarious forfeits.
Just make sure you don't get BINGO!
Includes bingo ball machine, check board, cards and tokens

The one, who don't get bingo or the last player wins the game!

Name: Roscoe Turner Air Race Game
Description:
Simple "Roll and Move" dice game simulating airplane races of the 1920-40s.  Game consists of 6 airplane miniatures and a board representing the race course.  In turn/position order players move their planes forward "dice roll" number of spaces avoiding other players and occasionally encountering beneficial or detrimental spaces on the race course.  First plane crossing the finish line (after a predetermined number of laps) wins.

—user summary

Name: Prince August Fantasy Adventure Game
Description:
The rules was included in a Prince August catalogue from the 1980-ish. It´s a simple set of rules for fantasy wargaming. The battle take place on a 3´x3´ battlefield table with terrain of your choice.

Sequence of play

     Both players write new orders, rally troops.
     Both players move each unit according to orders.
     Combat: (A. Missile fire, B. Hand-to-hand (melee), C. Mind combat and magic).
     Morale: Check morale and move units accordingly.
     Movement 2: Move any or all units again 2" or 3"


For each unit of the player on the board both players must write orders, corresponding to what he/she wants each unit to do in the course of the battle. A unit without orders cannot move. A unit cannot receive new orders unless it has a leader with it. All units must follow orders.

Mind combat is resolved before spells are cast. Only wizards may attempt to take over another creature´s mind.

The winner of the game is the one winning the battle.

The rules includes a battle scenario between the "Army of Neldoreth" (humans) and the "Gurthang´s Army" (undead).

Army of Neldoreth
1 King
1 Superhero
2 Heros
3 Wizards
24 Spearman
12 Bowmen

Gurthang´s Army
1 Gurthang
1 Sub-general on horse
10 Skeleton cavalry
15 Wraiths
24 Skeletons
35 Undead warriors

Name: Arctic Survival
Description:
Arctic Survival is a 2-4 player game of predator and prey that takes place on a ‘tundra’ of 25 cards arranged in a 5x5 grid. One team plays as lemmings, who move beneath the tundra searching for food and water to bring back to their burrow. The other team plays as foxes, who hunt on top of the tundra trying to dig up and catch the lemmings.

On the lemming turn, lemmings will roll, move, tunnel (by flipping cards) and search for resources. On the fox turn, foxes will roll, move, listen for lemmings, and pounce (by flipping cards in the opposite direction of the lemmings).

There are also adaptations and natural events hidden that can help the lemmings or foxes respectively and additional player tokens of the carrion beetle and polar bear that can change the tide of the game.

The game is designed to be both educational and fun. It can be used to teach about ecosystems, food chains, adaptations, abiotic and biotic elements, and the impacts of climate change.

—description from the publisher

Name: Waste Knights: Second Edition – Tales From The Outback
Description:
The Waste is in turmoil. New challenges arise as old technologies, strange cults and pre-Scourge secrets return to haunt the survivors of the apocalypse. From the war-torn west to the struggling east, the inhabitants of ruined Australia are longing for a moment of respite.

Will you be the one to grant it? Will you face the unknown threats to prove human superiority? Or maybe you will seize the opportunity and grab what you can before everything goes to hell? Time to prove your mettle against fearsome enemies and impossible dangers. Time to show everyone that your deserve to be called a Waste Knight!

INSIDE THE BOX:


     4 new Knights (Reverend Evans (Priest), Frank Strzelecki (Judge), Lisa Gomez (Scout), Warragul (Mercenary) with accompanying components (miniatures, sheets and upgrade cards)
     4 new Vehicles to get you exactly where you want to go
     The Guide and the Book of Tales featuring 4 new adventures, from co-op ones such as Rise of the Red Lord to competitive race found in Deadly Cargo along with their special cards, tokens and markers
     New rules featuring Landmarks for even better immersion in the setting, Parts enabling you to pimp up your ride, and City Tasks that provide you with more open-world gameplay
     New Wasteland Cards, tokens and markers for more variety whenever you ride out to the Waste


—description from publisher

Name: Una civilización en 45 minutos
Description:
Become the Master of the World by establishing and leading a civilization from the dawn of man to the space age. Discover new technological advances key to the development of humanity and build the most powerful empire the world has ever known.

A card game for 1-4 players (best with 2). Exchange technology advances with the shared card tableau to develop your civilization. Exchange Exploration and Gather cards with the shared tableau to expand your civilization and to gather the raw materials to invest in progressing your technology.

Name: Sous Scellés: La Clef
Description:
In Paris, the famous puzzle creator Fable Table is organizing a test for his new escape room...but at the end of the evening, his dead body is found. You thought you had come to play, and now you find yourselves in the middle of a crime scene...

La Clef ("The Key") is a murder-solving escape-room board game with a crime inside an escape room.

—description from the publisher

Name: Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition – Twilight Codex Volume III: Vigil
Description:
The Codex is a web-based publication that highlights rules updates and showcases new content for Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition and its Prophecy of Kings expansion.

This volume includes:

6 Alternative Faction Leaders
1 Alternative Faction Mech
3 Alternative Secret Objective Cards
2 Alternative Alliance Reference Cards
3 Alternative Faction Reference Cards
6 Additional Frontier Cards

A BRAND NEW FACTION: The Council Keleres
ã…¤1 New Faction Sheet
ã…¤5 New Faction Leaders
ã…¤2 New Faction Technologies
ã…¤1 New Faction Mech
ã…¤1 New Faction Promissory Note
ã…¤2 New Legendary Planet Cards
ã…¤1 New Alliance Reference Card
ã…¤1 New Faction Reference Card

Name: Turns -n- Time
Description:
Turns -n- Time is a Mechanism from the World of Bedlam. A world where humanity has evolved beyond the need for morality and the individual is protected as a productive unit within The Society.

An approved Mechanism, Turns -n- Time ensures Compliant Conflict Resolution without appealing to superstitious concepts such as morality or justice from humanity’s primitive past.

Turns -n- Time is an In-Hand Game, in which players attempt to disable their opponents mechanism before their own is disabled through tactical choices across 3 registers (direction, action, and element).

Name: Munchkin Dungeon: Cute as a Button Bookmarks
Description: Kickstarter exclusive bookmark pack (8) with the "Cute as a Button" expansion. These are in addition to the 4 bookmarks from the "Box of Holding" from the same Kickstarter.

Name: The Last Veggie
Description:
Winter is coming, so best start stockpiling your food! Whether it be through diligent collecting, immoral stealing, or charismatic trading, there’s no right or wrong way! Just survive!

The Last Veggie is a card game won by being the last remaining player with cards. As to how you obtain cards, that is up to the player. The game allows for passive players to simply draw and collect cards, aggressive players to readily steal cards, and strategic players to trade with others. Games go by quickly, so the winner is usually determined by whoever reaches a set number of games won (recommended 3 games). Build allies, play alone, be petty, do whatever you like. Just make sure that you are the last one standing at the end of the game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Hallux Rigidus (2nd Edition)
Description:
This is another release of the original with some alterations to improve various aspects of game play. Mainly we promised one of the characters could be the villain but with so many to choose from the statistics made it unlikely to happen so we reduced the number of characters to 6, the maximum number of players. Some possessions have been adjusted to conform better and certain wording improved for better in-play understanding without having to refer to the rule book.

Each person plays the role of a character that returns to Hallux Rigidus to gather evidence to discover the cause of the horrors that plague this small community. Once the cause is discovered, the players travel to the location in an attempt to end the horrors and save the town. The first player to successfully accomplish this, and retain his or her sanity, is the winner!

—description from the designer

Name: Butterfly Garden Duel
Description:
Help save the butterflies!  A city park has recently been zoned for development and you must help capture and relocate the endangered creatures.

Butterfly Garden Duel is a 1-2 player adaptation of Butterfly Garden. It is a "BYOP" game - "Bring Your Own Pencil" - so it is a print and play game that requires nothing other than the print-at-home sheets plus pencils.

In Butterfly Garden Duel, you compete with your opponent to spend time in the park collecting a variety of butterflies.  You also need to make sure you have the right jars to hold them.

Each round, players pledge to commit time to the task and the player who commits more time has their choice of which park areas to capture butterflies from and, it usually means you can capture more.  But, how much time you spend one day may limit your time on another, so you must carefully choose when to spend the most time.

—description from the designer

Name: Phantom Ink: Extra Secret Objectives
Description:
A promo card for Phantom Ink that can be obtained by registering your game on the Resonym website.

Adds six new words:
Cookie
Chimney
Ribbon
Birthday
Reindeer
Vacation

Name: 1807 The Big Four
Description:
18BF is a game in the 18xx series set in Great Britain.

A game of route building and running trains to make money. The player with the most assets (cash and share value) at the end wins.

Corporations start out small and grow into larger ones through growth, merger and/or acquisition. Then, later in the game, these larger corporations can merge to form systems: the "Big Four".

—description from the designer

Name: Immer vorwärts
Description:
Each player gets 6 or 12 meeples (soldiers). The two neighboring player colors are allied. Movement is determined by the actual starting space of the soldier to be moved. The arrow shows the direction of movement and the numeral the number od spaces to move. The direction of movement may be changed after the first space.

A soldier may shoot an enemy soldier if he get on a space exactly matching the shooters range, which is also determined by the arrow and mumeral on the space the shooter is standing on. The players may not look at the numerals of the spaces occupied by enemy soldiers. The shooter moves to the space of the shot soldier, which is removed from play. If the enemy soldier stands on a space inside the shooters shooting range, the shooter moves to the space matching his shooting range, whereas the shot soldier stays on his space und gets a ring around his neck to indicate that he is wounded. If a wounded soldier get a second wound, he dies and is removed from the game.

Wounded soldiers have to move back to their starting spaces to recover from their wound. On their way back they ignore the arrows and may not shoot at enemy soldiers.

The party or player to get the most soldiers to their opponents starting spaces wins the game.

Name: OSICA
Description:
Osica is a Japanese trading card game which use many popular Japanese anime IP such as yurucamp, miss kobayashi's dragon maid and so on.
In this game, player will use a deck of their favorite charaters to catch the opponent's heart, the player who makes the opponent's heart to 0 and then directly attack the opponent will win the game.

Name: Hunt A Killer: Class of '98
Description:
In Class of '98, you play a six-episode murder mystery as private eye for Gray Investigations.  Your boss was at her high school reunion in the small town of Chestnut Falls when local pharmacist Charles McDonagh is found murdered in his car on the side of the road.

The local sheriff is out of commission and asks Ms. Gray and her team to assist his inexperienced underling.

Of course, the pool of suspects is large with everyone coming back for the reunion, and Charles's seven old pals, the Hacky Pack and his wife are all suspects.  Can you sort through police reports, witness statements, and physical evidence to find the killer?

Do you have what it takes to Hunt A Killer? Immersive, story-driven board games for you to play alone or cooperatively. Sort through evidence, decode ciphers, piece together clues, and catch the killer.

Hunt a Killer: Class of '98 Box Set contains 6 episodes, each in its own box.

Difficulty: 2/5 - Medium

Name: Age of Steam Deluxe: Expansion Volume II
Description:
A collection of Age of Steam Deluxe expansion maps:
- Italy (3-6) / Portugal (3-6)
- Great Britain (3-6) / Texas, Oklahoma, New Mexico (3-6) / 1890 Berlin (3-6)
- Scotland (2) / Seattle Metro (1-3)

Each Expansion Volume of the set contains multiple maps on mounted game boards, plus the rules and any extra components needed to play each one.

Name: Age of Steam Deluxe: Expansion Volume I
Description:
A collection of Age of Steam Deluxe expansion maps:
- France (3-6) / Poland (3-6)
- Hungary (3-5) / Finland (3-6)
- New England (2) / Switzerland (3-4) / Pittsburgh (3)
- Heavy Cardboard (4-6)/ Detroit Bankruptcy (1-5)

Each Expansion Volume of the set contains multiple maps on mounted game boards, plus the rules and any extra components needed to play each one.

Name: Etat d'urgence: Pass Sanitaire
Description:
The mask is no longer mandatory, the places of life have reopened, the curfew is over and the summer holidays are fast approaching?

Let's go for the crazy adventure of the health pass! In this extension of the "état d'urgence" game, you will not only have to manage your game and avoid the twisted moves of your opponents, but also integrate the non-mandatory obligation to make your health pass before the 4th wave, which can arise at any time !

Name: Infantry Attacks: Franz Josef's Armies
Description:
An expansion book for Infantry Attacks: Fall of Empires adding the national armies (plus the tough Bosniaken regiments recruited in Bosnia-Hercegovina) to the campaign’s story. There are 28 new scenarios plus ten “battle games” linking together these scenarios plus those from Fall of Empires to tell the story of the 1914 campaign in Galicia.

Also includes 264 new die-cut and silky-smooth pieces adding the troops, weapons and leaders of the Landwehr, Honvédség and Bosniaken to the game.

Not a complete game. You’ll need Fall of Empires and August 1914 to enjoy the scenarios.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Sheep Leap
Description:
Somewhere in Ireland there is meadow with grazing sheep and a shepherd to take care of them.
Everything is peaceful...
 ...and so boring until the sheep start to jump over the fences.
Can you skip over all four fences before the shepherd catches one of the sheep or you run out of clovers?

Sheep Leap is a puzzle-ly solitaire in-hand game with only 17 cards. You can either use a regular card deck or the provided cards.

The game comes with 6 one-card expansions that you can mix and match to make it even more brain twisting.

—description from the designer

Name: Bot Hunters
Description:
Each bot is precious to a young Bot Hunter, who wants to get a good name among peers and to prove to be the best. Wild bots can be found everywhere and to catch them a hunter needs to fight them. To catch bots also means to gain their trust and their valuable help in completing your mission. Unfortunately, you will frequently meet other mysterious masked hunters, who won’t mind getting in the way and you will have to fight.

To catch bots, to use their powers to catch other bots, to defeat all masked hunters, and to create winning combinations to gather Victory Points. The game takes from 7 to 9 rounds. At the end of the game, players count their Victory Points: Victory points obtained from their bots ($), from combinations of bots, and from other bonuses received during the game. The player with the highest number of Victory Points is the winner.

Name: Micro Cosmos: New Worlds and Old Authorities
Description:
Micro Cosmos: New Worlds and Old Authorities is an expansion to Micro Cosmos. The box holds 2 modules that can be added to the base game as well as a unique solo campaign mode.

NEW WORLDS

The NEW WORLDS module introduces a new end game trigger and plays around with the scouting action and survivor cards more. You no longer have to wait for a planet of a proper type to be terraformed in order to settle a survivor on it. Your survivors can be sent to the titular New Worlds in order to gain points and benefits.

OLD AUTHORITIES

The OLD AUTHORITIES module introduces much more indirect interaction between players with the introduction of 3 Councils that players fight over. Whoever works hardest to appease a Council, receives a special ability they can use every turn. This module greatly encourages early terraforming which influences the gameplay in interesting ways.

The NEW WORLD and OLD AUTHORITIES modules can be added separately to the base game or played together for deeper gameplay.

SOLO CAMPAIGN
Dive into a multi chapter adventure and mark your progress in a dedicated campaign notepad. Each game of the campaign introduces some new twist, new challenge and with that new ways of going through the game.

You start your journey as a captain of a worn down ark and with each scenario you unlock upgrades and eventually new ships. A special card system determines the length of a scenario. The time it takes to complete is varied as are the tasks presented to you. Each completed task is worth experience points which allow you to perform upgrades on your ark. Each game session influences the campaign and shape of the galaxy. Your progress and game status is easily saved in a dedicated booklet which lets you come back and continue playing anytime you want.

-description from designer
